The '''Mornan''' was a dark valley in the [[White Mountains]] where the spring of the source of the [[Morthond]] was located.<ref>{{VT|42a}}, p. 14</ref>

== History ==
The Mornan was a dark and narrow valley that lay beneath the shadow of two high mountains in the [[White Mountains|Ered Nimrais]], being located directly to the south of [[Edoras]].<ref name="Mornan">{{NM|P3xxii}}, entry on "Morthond"</ref> Above the Mornan was a hidden gateway within some shadowed rocks which lead out from the [[Gate of the Dead Men]].<ref name="Mornan"/><ref name="Passing">{{RK|V2}}</ref>

On [[8 March]] {{TA|3019}}, [[Aragorn]], [[Gimli]], [[Legolas]], and the [[Grey Company]] exited the [[Paths of the Dead]] at the Mornan.<ref>{{App|TA}}</ref> They rode to the [[Stone of Erech]] where Aragorn, as the heir of [[Isildur]], called upon the [[Oathbreakers]] to follow him and fulfill their pledge.<ref name="Passing"/>

==Etymology==
[[Carl F. Hostetter]] has suggested that the name ''Mornan'' consists of ''[[mor|mor-]]'' ("dark") + ''[[nan]]'' (valley).<ref>{{VT|42a}}, p. 29 (note 31)</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2014: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The name "Mornan" is not used due to licensing restrictions, but Morthond does originate in a dark valley matching its description.
